IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE MISSOURI COALITION OF CHILDREN'S AGENCIES IS A STATEWIDE NETWORK SUPPORTING MEMBERS TO PROVIDE INNOVATIVE AND EFFECTIVE SERVICES TO CHILDREN AND FAMILIES THROUGH LEADERSHIP, ADVOCACY AND TRAINING.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE MISSOURI COALITION OF CHILDREN'S AGENCIES ENVISIONS A SOCIETY WHERE ALL CHILDREN REACH THEIR POTENTIAL IN SAFE, HEALTHY, PERMANENT FAMILIES, EMPOWERED BY COMPREHENSIVE COMMUNITY SUPPORT.
IRS990.Desc: MCCA provides the Medication Certification program to assist staff in private agencies to meet the requirements found in the residential child care regulations.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: CONFERENCES/EDUCATION/TRAINING FOR MEMBERS AND THOSE WHO ARE COMMITTED TO WORKING FOR THE WELFARE OF THE CHILDREN IN MISSOURI.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part IV, Line 2b: Explanation of escrow account liability
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DURING THE PRIOR FISCAL YEAR, FAMILY & FRIENDS ORGANIZED TO REFORM JUVENILE JUSTICE (FORJJ) (A NON RELATED ENTITY) WAS ATTEMPTING TO RECEIVE THEIR 501(C)(3) STATUS. WHILE THEY WERE WAITING TO RECEIVE THAT EXEMPT STATUS, THEY RECEIVED A GRANT AND SPENT SOME OF THE GRANT MONIES ON EXPENSES. MCCA IS HOLDING THAT MONEY IN A LIABILITY ACCOUNT LABELED FUNDS HELD FOR OTHERS. AS SOON AS FORJJ RECEIVES THEIR TAX EXEMPT STATUS, MCCA WILL TRANSFER THAT MONEY OVER. AS OF DECEMBER 31, 2015, THE LIABILITY ACCOUNT HAD $1,236.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 2: Description of Business or Family Relationship of Officers, Directors, Et
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PAT HOLTERMAN-HOMMES, DIRECTOR, YOUTH IN NEED - AGENCY MEMBER 1) FAMILY RESOURCE CENTER AND EPWORKS ARE PARTNERS IN THE CHILDREN'S PERMANENCY PARTNERSHIP (CPP), A LLC THAT HAS A STATE CONTRACT FOR FOSER CARE CASE MANAGEMENT SERVICES. 2) YOUTH IN NEED HAS A CONTRACTUAL RELATIONSHIP WITH EVERCHILD'S HOPE TO DELIVER EALY EDUCATION AND CARE SERVICES FOR INFANTS AND TODDLERS AS PART OF YOUTH IN NEED'S EARLY HEAD START GRANT. 30 YOUTH IN NEED HAS A CONTRACTUAL RELATIOHSNIP WITH LUTHERAN FAMILY & CHILDREN'S SERVICES TO DELIVER EARLY EDUCATION AND CARE SERVICES FOR INFANTS AND TODDLERS AS PART OF YOUTH IN NEED'S FEDERAL EARLY HEAD START GRANT.DENISE CROSS - BOARD MEMBER, CORNERTSTONES OF CARE - MEMBER AGENCY 1) MISSOURI BAPTIST CHILDREN'S HOME, EVERY CHILD'S HOPE, GREAT CIRCLE AND PRESBYTERIAN CHILDREN'S HOMES AND SERVICES AND CORNERSTONES OF CARE CO-OWNERS OF MISSOURI ALLIANCE FOR CHILDREN AND FAMILIES.KAREN NOLTE - BOARD MEMBER CHILDREN'S HOME SOCIETY MEMBER AGENCY 1) MEMORANDUM OF UNDERSTANDING TO PROVIDE ADMOPTION STABILIZATION SERVICES WITH LUTHERAN FAMILY AND CHILDREN SERVICES AND FAMILY RESOURCE CENTER 2) KAREN NOLTE IS SECRETARY OF AFCC - A MEMBER AGENCYMARILYN NOLAN - BOARD MEMBER PREFERRED FAMILY HEALTHCARE 1) PREFERRED FAMILY HEALTHCARE AND GOOD SAMARITAN BOYS RANCH ARE PARTNERS IN SPRINGFIELD PARTNERS LLC WHICH PROVIDES FOSTER CARE CASE MANAGEMENT SERVICES.ROBERT GIEGLING - BOARD MEMBER PRESBYTERIAN CHILDREN'S HOMES AND SERVICES 1) COLLABERATIVE IN-HOME THERAPY PROGRAM WITH EVERY CHILD'S HOPE 2) COLLABORATIVE PARTNER ALONG WITH EVERY CHILD'S HOPE, GREAT CIRLE AND MISSOURI BAPTIST CHILDREN'S HOME IN FOSTER CARE CASE MANAGEMENT 3) PART OWNER OF MISSOURI ALLIANCE ALONG WITH EVERY CHILD'S HOPE, GREAT CIRCLE, MISSOURI BAPTIST CHILDREN'S HOME AND CORNERTSTONES OF CAREJANINE HRON - BOARD MEMBER CRITTENTON CHILDREN'S CENTER MEMBER AGENCY 1) MEMORANDUM OF UNDERSTANDING WITH YOUTH IN NEED ALLOWING YOUTH IN NEED TO PARTICIPAT IN 3-YEAR MISSOURI WIDE REPLICATION OF CRITTENTON'S HEAD START TRAUMA SMART TRAUMA INTERVENTION MODEL.MICHAEL MEEHAN - BOARD MEMBER GOOD SHEPHERD CHILDREN & FAMILY SERVICES MEMBER AGENCY 1) COLLABORATES WITH CHILDREN'S HOME SOCIETY ON A STATE ALTERNATIVE TO ABORTION CONTRACT AND OCCASIONALLY PURCHASE SERVCES FROM CHILDREN'S HOME SOCIETY 2) COLLABRATES WITH MISSOURI BAPTIST CHILDREN'S HOME ON A STATE ALTERNATIVES TO ABORTION CONTRACT KEVIN DROLLINGER - BOARD MEMBER EPWORTH MEMBER AGENCY 1) CPP FOSTER CARE PARTNERSHIP WITH FAMILY RESOURCE CENTER AND YOUTH IN NEEDRUSSELL MARTIN - BOARD MEMBER MBCH CHILDREN AND FAMILY MINISTRIES MEMBER AGENCY 1) GREAT CIRCLE, PRESBYTERIAN CHILDREN'S HOME AND SERVICES, EVERY CHILD'S HOPE, CORNERSTONES OF CARE PROVIDERS OF SERCES WITH GREAT CIRCLE, PRESTYTERIAN CHILDREN'S HOME AND SERVICES, EVERY CHILD'S HOPE IN FCCM CONTRACT HELD BY MISSOURI ALLIANCE FOR CHILDREN AND FAMILIES 2) SUBCONTRACT IN FCCM CONTRACT HELP BY CORNERSTONES OF CARE

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 6: Explanation of Classes of Members or Shareholder
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CLASS 1 - FULL MEMBER - LICENSED ENTITY PROVIDING CHILD AND FAMILY SERVICES. THIS ENTITY SHALL BE ELIGIBLE TO HAVE ONE REPRESENTATIVE ON THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.CLASS 2 - PUBLIC AFFILIATE - GOVERNMENTAL AGENCY PROVIDING CHILD AND FAMILY SERVICES IN MISSOURI. THIS AGENCY SHALL HAVE NO REPRESENTATION ON THE BOARD AND NO VOTING PRIVILEGES.CLASS 3 - BUSINESS AFFILIATE - THIS IS A FOR-PROFIT VENDOR OF GOODS AND/OR SERVICES. THIS CATEGORY HAS NO VOTING PRIVILEGES.CLASS 4 - ADVOCATE - THIS INCLUDES ANY INDIVIDUAL INTERESTED IN THE WELFARE OF CHILDREN AND FAMILIES IN MISSOURI.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 7a: How Members or Shareholders Elect Governing Body
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BOARD OF DIRECTORS ARE ELECTED BY THE MEMBERS OF THE ORGANIZATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 7b: Describe Decisions of Governing Body Approval by Members or Shareholders
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BYLAW AMENDMENTS RECOMMENDED BY THE BOARD HAVE TO BE APPROVED BY THE MEMBERSHIP.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A PRELIMINARY COPY OF THE FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE GOVERNING BODY TO REVIEW PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ANNUALLY BOARD MEMBERS ARE REQUIRED TO SIGN A STATEMENT DISCLOSING ANY CONFLICTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15a: Compensation Review & Approval Process - CEO, Top Management
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION FOR THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED ANNUALLY BY THE PRESIDENT OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, POLICIES AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
